lead_paragraph: Cespedes arrived at the Mets’ complex three days before position players were required to report, leading Manager Terry Collins to say, “That’s the sign of a real pro.”

headline.print_headline: Cespedes Appears Early; the Mets Appear Pleased
headline.main: Yoenis Cespedes Appears Early; the Mets Appear Pleased

snippet: Cespedes arrived at the Mets’ complex three days before position players were required to report, leading Manager Terry Collins to say, “That’s the sign of a real pro.”
abstract: New York Mets outfielder Yoenis Cespedes reports early to spring training; team management takes early arrival as encouraging sign, particularly in wake of Cespedes's surprising choice to re-sign with team on three-year, $75 million contract.
